stimulusHtml: The trend depicted in the graph between the years 1899 and 1937 is best understood in the context of which of the following developments?

features.html:
• All values are approximate.

  • For the bar graph:

    • There are 38 bars representing Volume admitted each year.

    • Select Volume data from the bar graph are as follows:

      • 1899: 500

      • 1907: 5,000

      • 1909: 4,250

      • 1911: 6,750

      • 1914: 8,500

      • 1916: 4,500

      • 1917: 9,500

      • 1918: 5,500

      • 1921: 9,500

      • 1922: 5,000

      • 1924: 12,000

      • 1925: 1,250

      • 1930: 1,500

      • 1938: 300

  • For the line graph:

    • The following 2 lines are shown:

      • Net admissions

      • Departed

    • The Net admissions line data begin in 1908 and follow the trend of the bar graph, with values slightly lower than the values of the bars.

    • The Departed line begins in 1908 at 500, reaches a peak of 1,500 in 1922, then falls back to around 500 through 1937.

Winston James, “Explaining Afro-Caribbean Social Mobility in the United States: Beyond the Sowell Thesis,” Comparative Studies in Society and History 44, 4 (2002): 218-62, https://doi.org/10.1017/S0010417502000129.

choicesHtml: The heightening of tensions resulting from Afro-Caribbean immigration
A rise in the number of agricultural jobs in Southern states
The surge in the number of Black Southerners moving to the North
Increased Afro-Caribbean immigration into the United States
